learning_obj.text: Gain a comprehensive understanding of how to map out a process with SIPOC.
Utilize this information to improve the efficiency and customer experience of the process.
How SIPOC connects to worthwhile development.
How SIPOC can be used in a worthwhile development project.

characteristics.text: SIPOC maps out a process into:

sub_bullets.text: Suppliers - The input sources for the process
Inputs - The resources you need for the process to function
Process - The high-level steps of the process
Outputs - The results of the process
Customers - The people who receive outputs or benefit from the process

characteristics.text: Aims to improve customer experience and the efficiency of the production process, facilitate root cause analysis, and support risk management.
Visualizes how suppliers receive materials or data from each other.

process.text: Record suppliers, meaning anyone or any business who provides a resource used to make the product.
Record the inputs, which are resources used to make the process function and run the business.
Record the process in simple overarching steps.
Record the outputs, the products created, displayed in an intuitive order.
Track which different audiences and end users will consume or are projected to consume your products, listed in alignment with the outputs.

benefits.text: Identifies areas that may have unnecessary steps, reducing waste.
Can be used in multiple areas such as process improvement, new employee training, and understanding customer requests.
Improves communication within a project, ensuring partners know who is responsible for what.
Simplifies problem-solving to identify where issues may have originated.
Supports Worthwhile Development by tracking the impact of the project on people and the environment.

drawbacks.text: As SIPOC provides a high-level overview, it can overlook essential details and oversimplify complex projects.
Potential to be misinterpreted if not properly explained.
Overlap of suppliers can cause confusion, wasting time, money, and resources.

example.text: Track suppliers of the business, such as farmers and producers of ingredients in a restaurant.
Track inputs, including ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, and supplies needed to run the business.
Track the process of product creation using step-by-step stages such as cleaning, dicing, cooking, serving, and billing.
Record outputs such as food and drinks served to guests.
Track how each output will be received by the audienceâ€”in this case, guests ordering different menu items.

evaluation.text: Explain each of the five steps in SIPOC.
Sketch a quick SIPOC diagram for a hypothetical process such as running a laundromat.
Make a SIPOC graph for a specific part of your business goal.
